availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Corydon S. Abell (Harrodsburg, Kentucky, physician and politician)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, physician and politician. New York native. Married to Mary L. Moore Abell. Father of Mary M. Abell and Thomas Russell Abell. Assistant surgeon in the 3rd Regular U.S. Dragoons during the Mexican-American War from April 1847 to July 1848 . Physician in Harrodsburg in 1850 and 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mercer County, Kentucky, from 1859 to 1861. Declined a commission as Captain in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment in July 1861.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, District No. 2, p. 367B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer county, Harrodsburg p. 6; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 604; The Harrodsburg Herald (Harrodsburg, Ky.), April 23, 1903; Letters Received by the Office of the Adjutant General, Main Series, 1861-1870, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M619, Roll 0003; Francis B. Heitman, Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from it's Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903, Vol. 1, Part II (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1903), 150; Find A Grave, "Dr. Corydon S. Abell (1816-1903)," Memorial #55221621, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=55221621 (accessed August 30, 2017).
